intro: Dissochaeta bipulvinata, commonly known as the two-pulvinated dissochaeta, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in terminal inflorescences. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in shaded, moist habitats. Dissochaeta bipulvinata is noted for its unique pulvinates, which are specialized structures at the base of the leaves and stems.
